intro: Sphenanthera multangula, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces small, white or pinkish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant has succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid, mountainous habitat. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is adapted to cold, dry environments. Its botanical features make it a unique and resilient species found in alpine ecosystems.
